history.origin: Printed calendar sheets from 1909 with handwriting and illustrations added by Mary Behrend, found inside an envelope in a family baby album.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a woman in white pushing a stroller, talking to a woman in black named Gamie that has a black dog to the left of her.

div2.ab:
"There's something queer inside that thing"
Gamie seems to think-
"I really don't know what it is
That can only sleep and drink"

ab.add: What do you think is inside!

div2.note: This shows that Gamie is not sure about the baby that is inside of the stroller, and is very confused about the baby.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a white fish that is alive, then a drawing of the white fish cooked.

div2.ab:
fish day
This is the day we have
white-fish
truly a most delicious
dish.

ab.add:
are you having white fish today?
I'll be back soon love from Molly.

div2.note: This is showing that Mary is cooking fish for dinner and is asking if Ernst will be attending and having fish with her.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a house with grass around it, as well as smoke coming out of the chimney

div2.ab:
"Some love the glow of outward show
Some love mere wealth and try to win it
The house to me may lovely be
If I but like the people in it"
Chaz Levain
Very true indeed
div2.note: This shows that Mary loves the people that consist of her household and loves her house because of that.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a woman that is blushing because of the jewelry that is around her neck.

ab.add:
Jewels are all very nice
But Ernst & I will think twice
Before buying collars
For thousands of dollars
You see we ??????? the price!

I don’t want a
dog collar anyway
so it’s all right!
Love from Molly.

div2.note: This is showing that Mary is very conservative of her money and does not want to spend thousands of dollars on jewelry when they could because they were very financially stable.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: A picture of a basket that is very colorful and is adressed to Mr. Behrend.

ab.add:
May Baskets
No one knows who sends them
But they come each first of May
Just full of lovely things to eat
Upon this joyful day.

Do you know
Who sent this?
Love From Molly

div2.note: This shows that Mary is receiving packages every May and there are tasty treats within the basket.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a black and white clock that shows the time of 5:30 with an underline signifying a table that holds the clock.

ab.add:
A Fiendish invention
Is what I call this
Without it our lives
would be heavenly bliss!

div2.note: This shows that Mary does not like clocks and that they should be thrown away

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a bunny that is hopping with a blue tie around its collar and red ears.

ab.add:
This is not a "March Hare"
But a plain cotton bunny
When I look I must smile
He is really so funny!

div2.note: This is showing that Mary is so excited to see cotton bunnies and they make her smile and she all around is happy when she sees one.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a small grey dog that is drinking German beer with water underneath the dogs feet.

ab.add:
Mr. Reichemheims dog is queer
He likes that nasty German beer.
Here he is lapping it up -
Very bad for such a pup!

div2.note: This is showing that Mary is very unhappy at Mr. Reichemheims dog for liking German beer and expresses that it is really bad for a puppy like it to be drinking.

div2.fw: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDAR CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN.

figure.figDesc: Drawing of a large red house made with pencil and watercolor.

ab.add:
Mr. Conrad drew the plans to make the house much bigger.
He likes it all aside the price
It was an awful "figger!"

div2.note: The Behrends appear interested in expanding their house. They like the idea, but the price for the project was more than they expected and don't know if it's worth the cost, or if they should have this done at a cheaper rate.
